newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares close lower at end of settlement.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares close lower at end of settlement.

text.p: Delhi shares closed lower in thin trading on Friday as operators sold stocks to square up positions at the end of a settlement amid absence of buying by local mutual funds, brokers said.
The Delhi bourse's benchmark index closed 5.42 points lower at 771.91.
"End of the settlement mainly forced operators to square up their positions which pushed down stock prices," said Harish Malhotra of brokers Malhotra Financial Consultants.
State Bank of India dropped 2.50 rupees to 306.30.
Larsen and Toubro fell 1.70 rupees to 212.0.
